job_title: Per Diem Nurse in Concord, MA
pros: they care about us as workers unit is clean
cons: none that i can think of

job_title: Dining Room Server in Concord, MA
cons: Some of the scheduling was a little annoying and unclear at times.

pros: Residents are amazing. They are the reason many of us worked there.
cons: Since current person became CEO, there was an exodus of employees: front-line, administrative and management alike. He's way over his head. He emotionally manipulates, strategically plays favorites and run people's energy to the ground.

review_title: If you value your mental and physical health stay far away from dining services!
pros:
Free lunch & dinner
Benefits 
Diverse staff
1 hour break
cons:
Sexual harassment 

High turnover rate

Always short on staff.  In my 6+ years of working here management would always say we are short on staff.  Management expects you to work harder to make up for it. 

I worked here for 6+ years and never received a raise, but was expected to train others. I was also one of their only employees who knew how to host and serve. 

The attitude of certain Team Leaders! Was told by a certain Team Leader numerous times that serving isn’t a “real” job. It’s very obvious they look down upon their staff. 

Little opportunity for advancement. You either become a Team Leader or Dining Room Manager. 

Long hours! At the interview they will tell you shifts are 11AM to 8:30PM or 3:45PM to 8:30PM, but there have been plenty of times we didn’t get out until after 10PM!


Must work holidays

Residents do not value or respect the waitstaff. I have been physically assaulted by a resident and received little sympathy from management. I was basically expected to continue working. Another resident told me I look like pornstar Stormy Daniels and to “get some exercise.” He was spoken to by upper management, which angered him, so he decided to yell at me and call me a “snitch” in front of the whole dining room. Team Leader’s only response to him was that “we have work to do.” Upper management wrote a letter to Food Committee telling them to be nicer to the waitstaff. I literally heard them laughing about it at dinner that evening. These are just a few incidents, but I could name plenty more! 

No bussers or food runners. You must bus your own tables and run your own food.

pros:
Resident are nicer people in the world
Some staff are nice 
Nice times to work
cons:
Many bad manager make it hard for long time employee to stay
Hr say they will listen but side with bad manager

pros: Newbury Court  offers great benefits,  pleasant working environment and good employee perks. I have enjoyed my time here at Newbury Court.
cons: The community is constantly working on maintaining good communication.  Honestly there are few cons to working here. The most challenging thing is management talks about changes and it takes time to achieve them.

pros: Good management and nice place to work.
cons: Employees were to bossy at times with new hires.
